description: Small shops are allowed to open up in Austria, but the worst-hit areas of Italy are holding back.
title: Coronavirus: Austria and Italy reopen some shops as lockdown eased
title_page: Coronavirus: Austria and Italy reopen some shops as lockdown eased - BBC News
maintext: Also in the north, some of the worst-affected areas of Emilia-Romagna will stay locked down, while in Veneto officials are talking of a "soft lockdown". Bookshops and clothing stores can open for two days a week, says Veneto governor Luca Zaia, and a ban on exercising more than 200m away from home has been lifted. But residents will still need to wear a mask and gloves if they go out.
